qas.question: Who wotked with Carl Rogers on humanistic phycology?
In what century did humanistic phycology rise in prominence?
They introduced it in response to what?
Who worked with Carl Rogers on animal psychology?
What does humanistic psychology seek to misunderstand?
What century did humanistic psychology lose popularity?
Who was not accepted in their pursuits of psychoanalysis?

context: Humanistic psychology is a <a1_0><b5_0>psychological perspective<b5_0/><a1_0/> which rose to prominence in the mid-<a2_0><b6_0>20th century<b6_0/><a2_0/> in response to <b8_0>Sigmund Freud<b8_0/>'s psychoanalytic theory and B. F. Skinner's Behaviorism. The approach emphasizes an individual's inherent drive towards self-actualization and creativity. Psychologists Carl Rogers and <a0_0><b4_0>Abraham Maslow<b4_0/><a0_0/> introduced a positive, humanistic psychology in response to what they viewed as the overly pessimistic view of <a3_0>psychoanalysis<a3_0/> in the early 1960s. Other sources include the philosophies of <b7_0>existentialism and phenomenology<b7_0/>.
